result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-Trial Conference set for 11/14/22 - attempted, not known

3:42 PM Defendant Mauricio Martinez Gonzalez in court.  Attorney (Atty) Roberto R Ledesma in court for Mauricio Martinez Gonzalez.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present. 
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADA Pfeil would not object to an adjournment.

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mauricio Martinez Gonzalez in court. 
Interpreter Enrique Soria appears in court and is sworn by the clerk. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court asks the interpreter to go over the complaint with the defendant. 
Interpreter indicates the paperwork the defendant has is the bond form. 
Court provides a copy of the complaint and asks the interpreter to go over that in the hallway with him. 
Interpreter agrees and parties proceed to the hallway. 
1:57 p.m.  Court recalls the case. 

Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Court will adjourn for 2 weeks to allow the defendant to get representation if he qualifies. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Defendant is to go to the public defender's office.  

Defendant makes statements.
